She had this way of making you feel both intensely seen and perfectly calm. Her desk was a tiny island of order, her notebook was a map of the room's hidden conversations, and her occasional, almost imperceptible smile was the highest compliment you could get.

The thing about Relmi is that she didn't just *not* talkâ€”she actively listened in a way most people don't. So when she finally did speak, it landed with this weird, quiet gravity. It wasn't a opinion; it was a *resolution*. In that one sentence, she'd synthesize forty minutes of noise, expose the flaw in everyone's logic, and move on before the rest of us could even process it.

She was proof that the most powerful voice in the room doesn't always need to be the loudest. We were all shouting to be heard; she was the only one who was actually *listening* to the whole song. And that made all the difference.
